item.description:
It is now hunting season for deer with regular firearms so you would be smart to have some sort of blaze orange on both you and your dog(s).

The Purgatory Brook Trail follows the scenic Purgatory Brook which along it's 3 mile stretch of trail has 3 different water falls (upper, middle, and lower). Although the ground is rough in places it's nothing that can't be relatively easily navigated by simply watching where you put your feet. Although not necessary hiking poles could help with that. The section of brook we will be hiking on runs through the towns of Lyndeborough, Mont Vernon, and Milford. We will start near the lower falls and head upstream towards the upper falls.

Coming from Harvest Market in Bedford (NH 101) proceed 15.6 miles on NH 101 West.  At the light go straight across the intersection and proceed 0.8 miles on N. River Road.  At the intersection (Fitch's Corner) go straight across) onto Purgatory Road and proceed 0.5 miles. The parking lot we will start at  is on the left. There is a sign for both McLellan Trail and Purgatory Brook Trail there.  The actual address I used is a house (duplex) on the right side of the road just a bit past the parking lot. One can see the entrance to the parking lot from the house.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Purgatory Brook Trail - 3 Waterfalls - 6 Mile Line Hike.
